text:
I'm getting a null value when I call getParameter if the value contains an 
equals.

For example the following query string:

/cfd/main?action=resetorder&forward=/mainframe.jsp%3flayout=orderentry

If I call getParameter("forward") the return is null.

If I encode the query string as follows:

/cfd/main?action=resetorder&forward=/mainframe.jsp%3flayout%3dorderentry

Then I get the correct string (eg.  "=/mainframe.jsp%3flayout%3dorderentry"

This works with previous versions of tomcat (3.2.3 and prior)
creator: jason@abstractminds.com
remm@apache.org
text:
As I understand it in the HTTP spec, '=' is a special character, and should be 
encoded.

creator: lizas@corrigent.com
text:
I had looked at the code(RequestUtil.class) and found that there is an error in 
parsing the parameters.It was okey at the previous version of Tomcat.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
As I stated, the HTTP specification is quite clear about special characters in 
URLs, and they must be encoded. Since it is beyond the scope of the 
specification, I don't see the point of changing Tomcat behavior.
